intro: Koanophyllon chalceorithales, commonly known as the goldenleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of many small florets. The plant produces showy yellow ray flowers surrounded by a dense cluster of disk flowers, which are typically tubular in shape. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy appearance. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
